title: Physical Primary Source Analysis Assignment
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Overview and instructions for an assignment for First Year Seminar: Digital Archives in which first year students examine and analyze a primary source.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Exhibit Label Assignment
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Overview and instructions for an assignment for First Year Seminar: Digital Archives in which first year students write an exhibit label.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Digital Exhibit Project Assignment
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Overview and instructions for an assignment for First Year Seminar: Digital Archives in which first year students propose and create a digital exhibit on any topic using the platform of their choice.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Digital Primary Source Analysis Assignment
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Overview and instructions for an assignment for First Year Seminar: Digital Archives in which first year students analyze a digital primary source, either a born digital or a digitized source, and consider ways in which digital primary sources can be analyzed and understood in comparison to physical primary sources.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Commonplace Book Entry #2 Assignment
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Overview and instructions for an assignment for First Year Seminar: Digital Archives in which first year students write entries into a digital commonplace book of any platform or format on their understanding of the information ecosystem and how their understanding of physical and digital cultural heritage materials has changed throughout the course.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Digital Exhibit Presentation Assignment
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Overview and instructions for an assignment for First Year Seminar: Digital Archives in which first year students reflect on the digital exhibit they created for the course.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Finding Aid Analysis Activity
creator: Elizabeth James
description: In this activity, students analyze a finding aid and (optionally) compare the finding aid to the collection it describes to consider audiences for archival access documents and descriptive content.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Personal Digital Archives Plan Activity
creator: Elizabeth James
description: In this activity, students create a plan for ensuring the preservation of their digital files.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Exhibit Label Gallery Activity
creator: Elizabeth James
description: In this activity, students examine the exhibit labels they have written in the form of a gallery that is later remixed to form a new narrative to learn about the impact of physical proximity, tone, and more for items and exhibit labels.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Archival Collections as Data: A First Look Activity
creator: Elizabeth James
description: In this activity, students consider the usage of metadata describing digitized photos from the Jim Peppler Southern Courier Collection at the Alabama Department of Archives and History as data. Topics of note include bias in metadata creation and data visualization.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Repository Design Activity
creator: Elizabeth James
description: In this activity, students design a digital repository and consider audiences, collected content, and uses of the repository as well as implications of those decisions.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Digital Repository Analysis Activity
creator: Elizabeth James
description: In this activity, students will analyze digital repositories maintained by archives, libraries, and museums to consider the efficacy and variety of ways that cultural heritage materials are made accessible to individuals outside of the original institution.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: History in Your Home Activity
creator: Elizabeth James
description: This activity allows students to look at the physical items they interact with every day and examine them as though they were future historians looking at primary sources.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Your Digital History Activity
creator: Elizabeth James
description: The "Your Digital History" activity allows students to consider ways in which their digital lives might be understood and studied by future historians.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: First Year Seminar: Digital Archives Syllabus
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Syllabus for the required first year course, First Year Seminar (FYS) at Marshall University. FYS courses use central objectives and a selection of readings that are augmented with readings and activities based on a theme that draws from the expertise of the instructor. This iteration of the course focuses on physical and digital archives and imaged archives beyond these types.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Commonplace Book Entry #1 Assignment
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Overview and instructions for an assignment for First Year Seminar: Digital Archives in which first year students write entries into a physical commonplace book on the purpose and reality of higher education.
subject: Teaching Materials

title: Review of Advocacy and Awareness for Archivists
creator: Elizabeth James
description: “Review of Advocacy and Awareness for Archivists” in the Journal of Contemporary Archival Studies, December 2020. https://elischolar.library.yale.edu/jcas/vol7/iss1/21/
subject: Scholarship

title: Institutional Repositories and Archives Partnerships and Futures
creator: Elizabeth James; Lindsey Harper; Lori Thompson; Gretchen Beach
description: "Institutional Repositories and Archives Partnerships and Futures” with Lindsey M. Harper, Lori Thompson, and Gretchen Beach in the Mid-Atlantic Archivist, Vol. 49 No. 3, Summer 2020. https://marac.memberclicks.net/assets/maa/maracsummer2020.pdf
subject: Scholarship

title: The True University: Yale’s Library from 1843 to 1931
creator: Elizabeth James
description: “The True University: Yale’s Library from 1843 to 1931,” undergraduate history thesis, Yale University, New Haven, CT, Spring 2015. https://elischolar.library.yale.edu/mssa_yale_history/5/
subject: Scholarship

title: Heritage and Identity: The Cockayne Family Bible
creator: Elizabeth James
description: “Heritage and Identity: The Cockayne Family Bible,” in the Upper Ohio Valley Historical Review, Wheeling, WV, Spring 2016. https://mds.marshall.edu/lib_faculty/60/
subject: Scholarship

title: The People in the Papers: The Seaman Identification Card of Joseph Sofka
creator: Elizabeth James
description: “The People in the Papers: The Seaman Identification Card of Joseph Sofka,” in the Upper Ohio Valley Historical Review, Wheeling, WV, Winter 2016. https://mds.marshall.edu/lib_faculty/61/
subject: Scholarship

title: Memphis Tennessee Garrison: African American Activism in West Virginia Lesson Plan
creator: Elizabeth James
description: Through this activity, students will learn about the variety of civic actions and activism undertaken by Memphis Tennessee Garrison throughout her life. They will work to identify a cause or multiple causes that they are passionate about and determine how they can get involved with that cause in their community.
subject: Teaching Materials
